description: Indices of primes in sequence defined by A(0) = 99, A(n) = 10*A(n-1) - 71 for n > 0.
comments: Numbers n such that (820*10^n + 71)/9 is a prime.Numbers n such that digit 9 followed by n >= 0 occurrences of digit 1 followed by digit 9 is prime.Numbers corresponding to terms <= 1139 are certified primes. For number corresponding to 10393 and larger see P. De Geest, PDP Reference Table.
references: Klaus Brockhaus and Walter Oberschelp, Zahlenfolgen mit homogenem Ziffernkern, MNU 59/8 (2006), pp. 462-467.
links: Makoto Kamada, Prime numbers of the form 911...119.
Index entries for primes involving repunits.
example: 919 is prime, hence 1 is a term.
